title: JamesBorn
author: JamesBorn
content: Prior to this time, every social media occupied your pages with crypto and bitcoin news but it seems more interest values is losing and is kind of concern that nobody talks and comments about BTC again. Friday last week I have to boost my social media handle with a new name? And I surprisingly wake up this morning to see millions of follows, talking and updating their views. Bitcoin is our future currency we should encourage people, government and nations to always see it as one value assets every country should invest on. The more campaigns we creates relentlessly the more bitcoin attention will be draw into considerations. US, China, Indian, Nigeria and many more needs this project, let's make the government understand the values.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: I find it neutral to post about Bitcoin, how good it does etc. You're not making a difference, or very little. We have lots of Bitcoin theory, we need more practice. If you're not a merchant, the best thing you can do is to ask merchants if they accept it, so they can see it's demanded. We don't need a lot of social media activity around Bitcoin. Only if there are some fake news that need to be debunked.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on March 13, 2023, 02:44:52 PMPrior to this time, every social media occupied your pages with crypto and bitcoin news but it seems more interest values is losing and is kind of concern that nobody talks and comments about BTC again. It is not like people are no longer interested in bitcoins, that's an assumption, To me I feel that people are now more generally reserved about asking or talking about bitcoins to random people they meet on social media because of how fraudsters can take advantage of their ignorance and curiosity to lead them to bad websites and fraudulent cryptocurrency platforms. I have had chats with self acclaimed cryptocurrency professionals online and almost all of them want to lead me all the time to invest or buy bitcoins from a website that I am sure belongs to them. It is better you ask information from someone you know that is into bitcoin, not just any random person on social media claiming to know all about bitcoins.

comments.body: Not only on social media bundles, but crypto is also now being advertised using billboards in my country, the publicity is increasing on the highest order.

The side effects and disadvantages should also be considered valuable information to the general public.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Social medias give fake news and say so many untrue stories to mislead the people. Therefore, if they are not talking about bitcoin,I am OK with it,so that they don't make investors start to panic as the price is going dip. Moreover, social media is not for bitcoin discussion but for other activities because there are less people who have the knowledge of bitcoin but claim out there that they are experts.Bitcoin discussion can never stop because, it is a crptocurrency that has come to stay and there are investors who are monitoring the market. The adoption is spreading gradually and it is people that are singing the praises of bitcoin which is helping the spread of it. No matter the FUD ,bitcoin adoption is still increasing day by day. I talk to my friends and relations often about bitcoin.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on March 13, 2023, 02:44:52 PMFriday last week I have to boost my social media handle with a new name? And I surprisingly wake up this morning to see millions of follows, talking and updating their views. I don't understand this sentence. How did you boost your social media handle with a new name? do you mean the new name fetched you more followers who talk about bitcoin? Moving forward, social media is niched based, that's why people use hashtag on platforms like twitter and instagram. Between twitter has an interest board feature where you choose the kind of contents you wish to see on daily basis. And the cryptocurrency community is always active on twitter, reddit, medium and youtube. These are 4 social media platforms where cryptocurrency enthusiasts publish, regularly, contents about the market. So, I don't see much decline in the discussion rate of bitcoin users, but it can't be compared to the heavy amount of contents that follows the bullish season.
